result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael K Kern was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 125 days were granted.

May be transferred to Milwaukee.
Concurrent with: Case 17CF80.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $80.49 to be paid to US Bank as a condition of probation.
Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with Mariah S.
Agent to overview or manage any financial transactions, sign any/all releases needed.
Financial Responsibility Course recommended by Agent.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Request for expunction is denied.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael K Kern in court, in custody, with attorney Paul S. Crawford.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count #1. Court finds defendant guilty of Count #1. State makes recommendations. Atty. Crawford makes statements. Defendant makes statements. Case #16CF277, 17CM1125, and 17FO256 are dismissed and read in to this case.

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

300 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 125 days).  STAYED. Concurrent to 17CF80.

Term of Probation: 2 Years (May be transferred to Milwaukee) Concurrent to 17CF80.

Conditions of Probation:

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	
-No contact with Mariah S.

-Maintain/Obtain full time/part time employment;

-Agent to overview or manage any financial transactions, sign any/all releases needed

-Financial responsibility Course recommended by Agent

Restitution: $80.49 to be paid to US Bank as a condition of probation

FINE or COSTS:  $278.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  

Request for expunction is denied

Defendant Michael K Kern in court, in custody, with attorney Paul S. Crawford.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Before the court proceeds Atty. Crawford just wants  the court to take judicial notice of the Competency evaluation from 8/24/16 and the defendant's inability to read.  Defense is ready to proceed to hearing.  State is ready to proceed to hearing.  State calls their witness Detective Steve Guth with the City of Waukesha Police Dept.  Detective Guth sworn in and testifies on direct.  Cross examination by Atty. Crawford.  Testimony rests, witness is excused.  Testimony deemed closed.  State moves for bind over and presents closing arguments.  Atty. Crawford objects to bind over and presents closing arguments to the court.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of Information.  Bail remains as fixed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant requests a speedy trial in this matter only.  Hearing scheduled for April 28, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael K Kern in court, in custody, with attorney Paul S. Crawford.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Crawford indicates they were prepared for preliminary hearing today.  Attorney Thurston indicates the Officer is not available, therefore is requesting an adjournment.  Attorney Crawford is not objecting to an adjournment, however is requesting a quick date.  Court grants the request for adjournment.  The officer must be present for the preliminary hearing.   Court allows the matter to be scheduled within 10 days.  Attorney Crawford is requesting a modification of bail, or huber bailee status.  State takes no position.   The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail to include Huber bailee status.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael K Kern in court, in custody, with attorney Paul S. Crawford.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This matter was scheduled for a competency review, however the competency examination was never completed, therefore Attorney Crawford requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification of bail.  Defense Counsel requests order for competency pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 15 days.    The Court granted the Motion to Modify Bail.  Review hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Review hearing on August 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

To be done as an inpatient basis within 15 days.  Attorney Crawford requests a modification of bail.  State objects to a modification of bail.    The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail.  Bail remains as fixed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for August 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
